comments: We conjecture that for all n >= 0, a(n) equals floor(10^(n+1)/9)*7 with one of the (first) digits 7 replaced by a digit among {0, ..., 6}. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 22 2016
links: M. F. Hasler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200

Infinity, r, p = Permutations[ Join[ Table[ b, {i, 1, n}], {x, y}]]; q = {}; Do[q = Append[q, Replace[p, {x -> c[[i]], y -> c[[j]]}, 2]], {i, 1, 9}, {j, 1, 9}]; Min[ Select[ FromDigits /@ Flatten[q, 1], PrimeQ[ # ] & ]]]]; Table[ f[n, 7], {n, 1, 18}]
